bcl:text.#text: Subject to a regulation made under section 30 (2) (c) , the minister, in writing, may

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
In respect of a power or duty delegated under subsection (1), this Act and the
            regulations apply to the delegate as they apply to the minister.

bcl:text.#text:
Despite anything in this Act or the regulations, this Act and the regulations do

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The owner of an off-road vehicle may register the off-road vehicle with the
            Insurance Corporation of British Columbia.

Every application for the registration of an off-road vehicle with the Insurance
            Corporation of British Columbia under this section must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
in a form satisfactory to the Insurance Corporation of British
              Columbia,

delivered to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, a government agent
              or a person authorized in writing by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia for
              the purposes of this section, and
accompanied by the prescribed fees.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
On application for the registration of an off-road vehicle that is currently, or
            has previously been, registered or licensed in a jurisdiction other than British
            Columbia, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia may require, as a condition of
            registering the off-road vehicle, that the applicant surrender any current registration,
            licence or other documentation issued by the other jurisdiction in respect of the
            off-road vehicle.

On receiving the application and on being satisfied that the facts stated in it
            are true and that the prescribed fees have been paid, subject to the regulations, the
            Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must register the name and address of the
            owner and a description of the off-road vehicle in a file or an index to be kept for
            that purpose, and may issue to the owner

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a numbered certificate of registration in a form established by the Insurance
              Corporation of British Columbia showing the registration of the off-road vehicle,
              and
one distinctive number plate, decal or sticker.

bcl:text.#text:
Section 4 of the  and any regulations
          made under that section apply for the purposes of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must not accept any of the
            following from an applicant or transferee who is under 18 years of age:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an application for registration under section 4;
a notice of transfer under section 8;

an application for transfer of a certificate of registration under section
              9.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the application or notice is also signed by a parent or guardian of the
              applicant or transferee, or

the applicant or transferee, if unable to obtain the signature of a parent or
              guardian, proves to the satisfaction of the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia
              that the applicant or transferee is self-supporting or married.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the address of the owner of an off-road vehicle registered with the Insurance
            Corporation of British Columbia under this Act is changed from the address stated in the
            application on which a certificate of registration was issued under this Act or as shown
            on the certificate of registration, the owner must, within 10 days of the change of
            address, notify the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia in writing or by some
            other means approved by the corporation of the owner's former address and new
            address.

In the case of a change of name, by marriage or otherwise, of the owner of an
            off-road vehicle registered with the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia under
            this Act, the owner must, within 10 days of the change of name, notify the Insurance
            Corporation of British Columbia in writing of the owner's former name and new name in
            full.

If the title or interest of a person in an off-road vehicle registered with the
            Insurance Corporation of British Columbia is transferred by gift, exchange, barter or
            sale,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the transferor and the transferee of the title or interest must immediately
              sign a notice of the transfer in a form satisfactory to the Insurance Corporation of
              British Columbia, and

the transferee must, within 10 days from the date of the transfer, deliver the
              notice of transfer, accompanied by the prescribed fees, to the Insurance Corporation
              of British Columbia for registration by the corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If there is a transfer, by operation of law, of the title or interest of an
            owner of an off-road vehicle registered with the Insurance Corporation of British
            Columbia by way of inheritance, bequest, order in bankruptcy, execution sale,
            repossession on default in performance of a lease or a conditional sale contract, or by
            means other than the voluntary act of the person whose title or interest is
            transferred,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the notice of transfer under this section must be signed by the executor,
              administrator, receiver, trustee, sheriff or other representative or successor in
              interest of the person whose title or interest is so transferred in place of that
              person, and

the person who signs the notice of transfer must transmit to the Insurance
              Corporation of British Columbia evidence satisfactory to the corporation of all the
              facts entitling that person to sign the notice of transfer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The form of the notice of transfer under subsection (2) may be varied in
            accordance with the facts of the case.

All documents required to be transmitted to the Insurance Corporation of British
            Columbia under this section may be delivered to the Insurance Corporation of British
            Columbia, a government agent or a person authorized in writing by the Insurance
            Corporation of British Columbia for the purposes of this section.

A person who delivers a notice of transfer to the Insurance Corporation of
            British Columbia under this section must surrender, at the same time, the certificate of
            registration last issued for the off-road vehicle.

On receiving a notice of transfer under this section, subject to the regulations
            and payment of the prescribed fees, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia may
            issue

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a new certificate of registration for the off-road vehicle in the name of the
              transferee, and
one distinctive number plate, decal or sticker.

Despite any enactment, if, after the death of a registered holder of a
            certificate of registration for an off-road vehicle, a person

the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia may accept the application for a
            transfer and, subject to the regulations and payment of the prescribed fees, may issue a
            new certificate of registration for the off-road vehicle in the name of the
            applicant.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: applies for a transfer of the certificate of registration,

proves to the satisfaction of the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia
              that the total estate left by the deceased did not exceed $25 000 in value,
              and

satisfies the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, by producing the last
              will of the deceased, that the person entitled under the will consents, or if the
              deceased died intestate, by showing that all persons entitled to share in the estate
              on intestacy consent,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who applies to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia for a
            transfer of a certificate of registration under subsection (1) must surrender, at the
            same time, the certificate of registration last issued for the off-road
            vehicle.
Section 8 (4) applies to an application under this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If any of the following circumstances exist, the owner of an off-road vehicle
            must immediately apply to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia for a vehicle
            identification number for the off-road vehicle:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the off-road vehicle does not have a vehicle identification number;

a vehicle identification number on the off-road vehicle is different from any
              other vehicle identification number on the off-road vehicle;

a vehicle identification number on the off-road vehicle has become illegible
              or has been altered, removed or obliterated.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia is satisfied that an
            application under subsection (1) is made by the lawful owner of the off-road vehicle,
            the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia may, subject to the payment of the
            prescribed fees, assign a vehicle identification number to the off-road
            vehicle.

If the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia assigns a vehicle
            identification number to an off-road vehicle under subsection (2), the owner of the
            off-road vehicle must cause the vehicle identification number to be applied, by a method
            designated by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, on the part or parts of the
            off-road vehicle designated by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia.

If the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia is satisfied that a vehicle
            identification number has been assigned and applied under this section to an off-road
            vehicle that is registered with the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, the
            Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must cause the vehicle identification number
            to be inserted into the off-road vehicle's registration record.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Alteration, removal or obliteration of vehicle identification
          number

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person must not alter, remove or obliterate a vehicle identification number on
            an off-road vehicle.

Subsection (1) does not apply to a person who alters, removes or obliterates a
            vehicle identification number on an off-road vehicle during regular maintenance of the
            off-road vehicle, or during any repair or other work carried out on the off-road vehicle
            for a legitimate purpose, including a modification of the off-road vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Alteration and fictitious use of number plates or
          documents

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: alter, obliterate or repaint a figure or letter

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: on a number plate, decal or sticker issued under this Act, or

on a certificate of registration, permit or other document issued under this
                Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: use or operate on Crown land or prescribed private land an off-road vehicle that has displayed on it

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a number plate, decal or sticker issued under this Act, or a document referred to in paragraph (a) (ii), on which a figure or letter has been altered, obliterated or repainted, or

a number plate, decal, sticker or other document that has not been issued under this Act but that is of a colour or design resembling or purporting to be a number plate, decal or sticker issued under this Act or a document referred to in paragraph (a) (ii);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: while using or operating an off-road vehicle on Crown land or prescribed private land, use or be in possession of a fictitious or invalid number plate, decal or sticker, or a certificate of registration, permit or other document, purporting to be issued under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) (b) applies to a number plate, decal, sticker or other document issued by a jurisdiction other than British Columbia in respect of an off-road vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Operation prohibited without registration or permit
bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to the regulations, a person must not use or operate, or authorize or permit another person to use or operate, an off-road vehicle on Crown land or prescribed private land unless one of the following applies:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the off-road vehicle is registered with the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia under this Act;

bcl:text.#text: the off-road vehicle is registered and licensed under the  or the ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the off-road vehicle

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is registered or licensed in a jurisdiction other than British Columbia, and
has displayed on it, in the manner prescribed, the number plate, decal or sticker issued by that jurisdiction in respect of the registration or licensing of the off-road vehicle;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: [Not in force.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not use or operate an off-road vehicle that is registered with the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia under this Act on Crown land or prescribed private land unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person has in the person's possession the certificate of registration, or a copy of it, issued for the off-road vehicle under this Act, and
the off-road vehicle has displayed on it, in the manner prescribed, the number plate, decal or sticker issued under this Act in respect of that off-road vehicle.

bcl:text.#text: A person must not use or operate an off-road vehicle that is registered and licensed under the  or the  on Crown land or prescribed private land unless
the person has in the person's possession the licence, or a copy of it, issued for the off-road vehicle under the  or the , and
the off-road vehicle has displayed on it, in the manner prescribed, the number plate issued under the  or the  in respect of that off-road vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not use or operate an off-road vehicle referred to in section 14 (c) (i) on Crown land or prescribed private land unless the person has in the person's possession the documentation issued by the other jurisdiction in respect of the off-road vehicle that is specified by regulation.

A person must not use or operate an off-road vehicle on Crown land or prescribed
            private land

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
in a careless, reckless or negligent manner that may endanger or cause injury
              to persons or damage to property, or

in such a manner as to harass, run over, injure or kill wildlife, livestock or
              a domestic animal.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not use or operate an off-road vehicle

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on the tracks of an operating railway, or

on private land without the consent of the owner, lessee or occupant of the
              private land.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who holds a permit issued under this Act must comply with the terms,
            limits and conditions of the permit.
A person must not use or operate, or ride as a passenger on, an off-road vehicle on Crown land or prescribed private land if the person is not wearing an off-road vehicle safety helmet that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is designated in the regulations as an approved off-road vehicle safety helmet, or
meets the prescribed standards and specifications for off-road vehicle safety helmets.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who uses or operates an off-road vehicle on Crown land or prescribed private land must not permit another person under 16 years of age to ride as a passenger on the off-road vehicle in contravention of subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must not use or operate an off-road vehicle on Crown land or prescribed private land from 1/2 hour after sunset to 1/2 hour before sunrise or at any other time when, due to insufficient light or unfavourable atmospheric conditions, objects are not clearly discernible at a distance specified by regulation unless all of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the off-road vehicle carries all lamps, reflectors and other illuminating devices required by the regulations;
all of the required lamps, reflectors and other illuminating devices are maintained in good working order and in accordance with any requirements specified by regulation;
all of the required lamps and other illuminating devices are illuminated.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person 19 years of age or older must not authorize or permit another person under 16 years of age

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to use or operate an off-road vehicle contrary to section 17 (1) (a) or (b) or (2) (a) or (b), 18 (1) or 19, or
to contravene, if the other person holds a permit issued under this Act, a term, limit or condition of the permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Officers empowered to stop and inspect vehicles

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purpose of administering or enforcing this Act and the regulations, an
            officer may require a person using or operating an off-road vehicle to do any of the
            following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: stop the off-road vehicle;

state correctly the person's name and address and, if the person is not the
              owner, the name and address of the owner of the off-road vehicle;

produce any document or identification that the person is required under this
              Act or by regulation to have in the person's possession while using or operating an
              off-road vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person using or operating an off-road vehicle must stop the off-road vehicle
            if required to do so by an officer under subsection (1) (a) if the officer

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is in uniform,
displays the officer's official identification, or

is in or near a motor vehicle that is readily identifiable as a motor vehicle
              of an officer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person using or operating an off-road vehicle, if required to do so by an
            officer under subsection (1), must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
state correctly the person's name and address and, if the person is not the
              owner, the name and address of the owner of the off-road vehicle, and

produce any document or identification that the person is required under this
              Act or by regulation to have in the person's possession while using or operating an
              off-road vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purpose of administering or enforcing this Act and the regulations, an
            officer, without a warrant, may inspect any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an off-road vehicle;

any vehicle or equipment that is attached to or is being towed by an off-road
              vehicle;

any off-road vehicle safety helmet or safety equipment that a person is
              required under this Act or by regulation to use, wear or carry while using or
              operating, or riding as a passenger on, an off-road vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
A person must not hinder, obstruct, impede or otherwise interfere with an officer
          who is exercising powers or performing duties under this Act or under a warrant issued for
          the purposes of enforcing this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who contravenes any of the following commits an offence and is liable
            on conviction to a fine of not more than $2 000:

bcl:text.#text: section 7 (1) or (2) ;
section 8 (1) (b) ;
section 11 (1) or (3) ;
section 16 (5) (a) or (b) ;
section 17 (3) ;
section 18 (1) or (2) ;
section 19 (a), (b) or (c) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subsection (5) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who contravenes any of the following commits an offence and is liable

bcl:text.in:desc:

A person who contravenes any of the following commits an offence and is liable

bcl:text.#text: section 17 (1) (a) or (b) ;

Every day that a contravention under subsection (1), (2) or (3) continues
            constitutes a separate offence.
A person must not make a false statement in any of the following:

bcl:text.#text:
an application for registration under section 4
                ;
a notice of transfer under section 8 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [transfer on death of owner if estate small]
bcl:text.#text:
an application for transfer of a certificate of registration under section 9
                ;

an application for a vehicle identification number under section 11
                ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an application for a permit under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a corporation commits an offence under this Act, an employee, officer,
            director or agent of the corporation who authorizes, permits or acquiesces in the
            commission of the offence also commits the offence, whether or not the corporation is
            prosecuted for that offence.

If a person is convicted of an offence under this Act, the court, in addition to
            imposing a penalty under subsection (1), (2) or (3), may by order

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
require the person to pay to the government or to any other person who suffers
              damage to property because of the commission of the offence, a sum that, in the
              court's opinion, is reasonably required to compensate the government or other person
              for that damage, and

prohibit the person from using or operating an off-road vehicle or a class of
              off-road vehicle for the length of time the court considers advisable.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person referred to in subsection (7) must comply with an order of the court
            under that subsection.

bcl:text.#text:
Section 5 of the  does not apply to this
            Act or the regulations.

If the maximum fine or term of imprisonment provided by a regulation under
            section 30 (2) (s)  is less than that provided
            by this section, the regulation prevails.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The time limit for laying an information to commence a prosecution for an
            offence under this Act is 2 years after the date on which the facts that lead to the
            laying of the information first came to the knowledge of an officer.

An officer referred to in subsection (1) may issue a document certifying the
            date referred to in that subsection.

A document issued under subsection (2) is proof, in the absence of evidence to
            the contrary, of the matter certified in the document.

The owner of an off-road vehicle is liable for any contravention of this Act or
            the regulations relating to the use or operation of the off-road vehicle.

An owner is not liable under subsection (1) if the owner establishes
            that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the person in possession of the off-road vehicle at the time of the
              contravention was not entrusted by the owner with possession, or

the owner exercised reasonable care and diligence in entrusting the off-road
              vehicle to the person in possession of the off-road vehicle at the time of the
              contravention.

bcl:text:
An owner is not liable under subsection (1) with respect to an offence if the
            person in possession of the off-road vehicle at the time of the contravention has been
            convicted of
arising out of the same circumstances.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the same offence, or
an included offence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If an owner is liable under subsection (1) with respect to an offence, in place
            of the fine or term of imprisonment specified in this Act or the regulations for the
            offence, a fine of not more than $5 000 may be imposed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Detention of seized property until fine paid

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person is convicted of an offence under this Act,

bcl:text.#text:
property is ordered returned to the person under section 24.2 (4) (a) or (b)
              of the , and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a fine is imposed on that person by the court.

bcl:text.#text:
Despite the order under section 24.2 (4) (a) or (b) of the , the responsible official as defined in section 24 (1) of
            that Act must deliver the property referred to in subsection (1) (b) of this section to
            the minister and the minister may detain that property until the fine is
            paid.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the fine referred to in subsection (1) (c) is not paid within the time the
            court sets for payment, the detained property is forfeited to the government, to be
            disposed of as the minister directs.

Proceeds of a disposition under subsection (3) must be applied towards payment
            of the fine referred to in subsection (1) (c).

bcl:text.#text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section
            41 of the .

Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make
            regulations as follows:

for the purposes of the definition of "off-road vehicle" in section 1
                , prescribing

including, without limitation, prescribing names for the classes of
              vehicles;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
classes of vehicles for the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition,
                and
classes of vehicles that are excluded from the definition,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
prescribing private land or classes of private land for the purposes of the

respecting the use or operation of off-road vehicles on Crown land or

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows respecting the
          use and operation of off-road vehicles on Crown land or prescribed private
          land:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
respecting the safe use and operation of off-road vehicles, including, without
            limitation,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
safety rules, requirements, standards and specifications respecting off-road
              vehicles, and

safety rules and requirements for persons who use or operate, or ride as
              passengers on, an off-road vehicle;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
respecting safety equipment that a person must use, wear or carry while using or
            operating, or riding as a passenger on, an off-road vehicle, including, without
            limitation,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: defining types of safety equipment, and

prescribing requirements, standards and specifications respecting safety
              equipment;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: without limiting paragraph (b) of this section,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
designating a helmet as an approved off-road vehicle safety helmet for the
              purposes of section 18 (1) (a), and

prescribing standards and specifications for off-road vehicle safety helmets
              for the purposes of section 18 (1) (b);

bcl:text.#text:
without limiting paragraph (b) of this section, specifying a distance for the
            purposes of section 19  and respecting
            lamps, reflectors and other illuminating devices for the purposes of paragraphs (a) and
            (b) of that section;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
respecting safety inspections of off-road vehicles, including, without
            limitation, requiring off-road vehicles to be safety inspected;
respecting safety training for persons who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: use or operate off-road vehicles, or

supervise another person, for the purposes of this Act or the regulations,
              while that person uses or operates an off-road vehicle;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
requiring a person, including a person in a prescribed class of persons, to do
            something before using or operating an off-road vehicle, or as a condition of being
            authorized under this Act to use or operate an off-road vehicle, including, without
            limitation, one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
obtain a permit, in accordance with the regulations, for the use or operation
              of an off-road vehicle;

successfully complete a safety training course or program approved by the
              minister;

be supervised by another person who meets prescribed requirements while the
              first person uses or operates an off-road vehicle;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
prescribing requirements that must be met by a person who, for the purposes of
            this Act or the regulations, supervises another person while that person uses or
            operates an off-road vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Regulations — prohibition and regulation of off-road
          vehicles
bcl:section.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: authorizing the minister

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
to prohibit or regulate by order, in prescribed circumstances, the use or
              operation of off-road vehicles or a class of off-road vehicles in a geographic area or
              during a period of time specified in the order, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
requiring that notice of an order referred to in paragraph (b) be given in the
            prescribed manner or form and within the prescribed period.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Despite any other provision of this Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may
          make regulations exempting any of the following, on any conditions, for any periods of
          time and in any circumstances that are considered advisable, from all or any part of this
          Act or the regulations:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: off-road vehicles and classes of off-road vehicles;
persons or organizations and classes of persons or organizations;
geographic areas or land and classes of land.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations respecting permits under
          this Act in relation to off-road vehicles, the use or operation of off-road vehicles,
          persons, organizations, geographic areas, and seasons or periods of time, including,
          without limitation, respecting any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: form and issue of permits;
renewal, replacement or transfer of permits;

authorizing a person or other entity to issue permits under this Act or to
            renew, replace or transfer permits issued under this Act;
terms, limits or conditions of permits;
fees for permits.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
In making a regulation under this Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may do
            one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: delegate a matter to a person;
confer a discretion on a person;

establish or define classes of places, things, activities, persons or
              organizations;

make different regulations for different places, things, off-road vehicles,
              activities, persons or organizations, or for different classes of places, things,
              off-road vehicles, activities, persons or organizations, including classes of persons
              based on age.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
In making a regulation under this Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may
            adopt by reference, with or without modification, a code, standard, specification or
            rule, or part of any of them,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
set by a provincial, national or international body or any other code,
              standard, specification or rule-making body, or

enacted as or under a law of another jurisdiction, including a foreign
              jurisdiction.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A code, standard, specification or rule referred to in subsection (2) may be
            adopted as amended from time to time.

bcl:text.#text:
Subject to section 17 of the , all fees collected under this Act must be paid into the
          consolidated revenue fund.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:

                Corporation of British Columbia in accordance with this Act, and
12 months after the date this section comes into force.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The owner of a designated off-road vehicle must, within the 12 month period
            after the date this section comes into force, register the designated off-road vehicle
            with the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia in accordance with this
            Act.

If the minister is satisfied that an owner of a designated off-road vehicle has
            registered the designated off-road vehicle with the Insurance Corporation of British
            Columbia in accordance with subsection (2), the minister may grant a refund in the
            prescribed amount to the owner.

To claim a refund under subsection (3), an owner of a designated off-road
            vehicle must submit to the minister

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an application in the form and manner satisfactory to the minister, and
any information or document required by the minister.
